main_definition: Corrections refer to the act of making changes, adjustments or amendments, especially in written text or as a form of punishment.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Acts of fixing errors or mistakes
meanings_and_examples.example: After proofreading her essay, she made several corrections to grammar and spelling.
Inmates may serve time in the prison's work release program as a form of correctional training.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Changes made to written text or data, such as revisions and edits
meanings_and_examples.example: The author made corrections to his manuscript before submitting it for publication.

meanings_and_examples.definition: A place where individuals receive discipline and rehabilitation
meanings_and_examples.example: Many people have a negative perception of the correctional facilities due to their past experiences or stories they've heard.
